document.docAuthor: Rafael, José Albertino & Cumming, Jeffrey M.
document.docTitle: Macrostomus xavieri Rafael & Cumming, 2015, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the genus Macrostomus Wiedemann (Diptera, Empididae, Empidinae). IV. The amazonensis species-group

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of the genus Macrostomus Wiedemann (Diptera, Empididae, Empidinae). IV. The amazonensis species-group

subSubSection.paragraph: Diagnosis . Thorax entirely black. Abdomen including terminalia black. Male tergite 8 short, with shallow sinus anteriorly. Posterior cercus curved inward. Female: fore coxa black, remaining yellow; female and some males with hind femur black and yellow banded. Hind tibia without pinnate setae.

caption.paragraph:

45–49 , paratype ♂. 45 , tergite 8, dorsal view, right setae omitted; 46 , epandrium detached, lateral view (gray colored); 47 , hypandrium and cerci (cerci gray colored, tergite 8 setae omitted), lateral view; 48 , ventral projection of cerci with developed expansion, anterodorsal view; 49 , cercal bridge connecting anterior cerci, anterodorsal view, setae omitted; 50–53 , paratype ♀. 50 , tergite 8 and sternite 8, lateral view, setae omitted; 51 , tergite 8, dorsal view; 52 , sternite 8, ventral view; 53 , genital fork, ventral view. Abbreviations: AC, anterior cercus: BS, baciliform sclerite; VPC, ventral projection of cercus. Scales: 45–49, 50–52 = 0.2 mm; 53 = 0.1 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material
.
HOLOTYPE
♂: “ BRASIL , Amazonas, Manaus, F[azenda] Esteio, BR- 174 , km- 41 , ZF 3 ”, “
21–23 .x. 1993
, F.F.Xavier” “
Macrostomus xavieri Holótipo
♂” (red label) ( INPA ).
PARATYPES
.
BRAZIL
. Same data as holotype , except
17-21 .i. 1994
(
3 ♂
, 2 ♀ INPA ;
3 ♂
, 2 ♀ CNC ).
GUYANA
, Coll. Richards & Smart, B.M. 1937 – 776 , Kaieteur, high forest,
05.ix. 1937
(
2 ♂
, 1 ♀ BMNH ).

Holotype condition
. Pinned, in good condition, not dissected.
Etymology . Named in honor of Mr. Francisco Felipe Xavier Filho, an INPA technician who has collected many insects in the Amazon Basin.
Variation . Some male specimens have hind femur banded with yellow at base and subapically, and black at middle and apically.

Discussion .
Macrostomus xavieri
sp. nov.
may be related to both
M. amazonensis
sp. n.
and
M. paraiba
sp. nov .
Females of all three species have similar terminalia with sternite 8 bearing a lateral cleft that is smaller and more basal in
M. xavieri
(
Fig. 50
), and a genital fork with detached (
M. amazonensis
and
M. paraiba
) or nearly detached (
M. xavieri
) lateral arms (
Fig. 53
).
